Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on

the violations cited in the report. It should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any

immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(4) If an emergency change in placement is necessary, then
all of the documentation required in subrules (2) and (3) of
this rule shall be in the child's record within 14 calendar
days after the change in placement.
One of the four current foster child records reviewed indicated the foster child had a
change in placement that was not appropriately documented within the time frame
required by this rule. In this situation the youth had a one-night stay in a foster home
following an AWOL situation before being returned to the youth’s residential
placement at that time. The required documentation has subsequently been
completed and placed within the foster child’s record.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
 All signed documents should include dates of signature
 Contact with caregivers shall be documented clearly in the case contacts at
the required intervals
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 All signed documents should include dates of signature
 Contact with caregivers shall be documented clearly in the case contacts at
the required intervals
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
4

maltreatment during this licensing period for their interim evaluation completed
08/31/2020. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that inspection were R
400.12404 (6)(a), R 400.12405 (3)(f), R 400.12417 (1)(a), and R 400.12420 (1)(e).
None of these specific areas were identified in noncompliance as a part of this
renewal review although a different subset of R 400.12405 was cited as R
400.12405 (4).
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator report dated 04/14/2021 was received. Areas reviewed as a
part of that report included issues related to foster parent information, foster child
placement, foster child change in placement, and appropriately addressing changes
in the updated service plan as needed.
Interviews
Eight foster care services related staff participated in entrance and exit interviews
with no areas of concern noted.
FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
